631274145.name: Best hideout from the HEAT
631274145.author: a TripAdvisor user
631274145.reviewBody: During hot summer days, which in this part of M\u00e9xico goes almost year round it is a great way to walk the city belly under. It used to be a water canal, and some say it was used also as a hideout by the Chinese during a racial persecution period, and by smugglers. It has some newspaper front pages from the early days of the thriving city. Bring a charged phone, because it makes for great pics.

588670199.name: Underground tunnel
588670199.author: a TripAdvisor user
588670199.reviewBody: Interesting to see such a solid underground tunnel. Parts are sectioned off--some historic displays along the way. Staff or guards posted along the way to keep visitors on track and safe. Well-lit, might be a little scary at night. I was fine as a solo visitor on a Saturday morning.

495429716.name: Very Interesting!
495429716.author: a TripAdvisor user
495429716.reviewBody: As we had time in the evening, a local colleague took us to Old Centre Torreon. This underground former canal is a nice attraction - they have spent good money to recover, clean up and beautify this 100 years old structure - great visit, great history lesson.

448932144.name: History lessons
448932144.author: a TripAdvisor user
448932144.reviewBody: This is an interesting tunnel which shows a lot of unknown facts of the local History.    Very recommendable to visit and learn.    However it is still is a work in progress, hopefully more attractions can be added soon.

287433761.name: Getting better all the time
287433761.author: a TripAdvisor user
287433761.reviewBody: More of the canal has opened, revealing more of the history of Torreon. It\'s a little creepy in the tunnel (I probably wouldn\'t go down there alone even though there are officers inside), but it\'s a nice break from the hot sun.

278386395.name: History and art
278386395.author: a TripAdvisor user
278386395.reviewBody:
25°32'17.13"N 103°27'41.73"W

This used to be a canal that brought water into Torreon (Coahuila, Mexico). 

Built in 1893, it was closed for security reasons and re-opened as a  tourist place in 2014.

When in Torreon, you must go and visit it. It hosts an art gallery and mucho mas. (Much more)
For example, we sw a play for children the night we were there. Better, it was free.

611846539.name: Beautiful air-conditioned oasis of culture
611846539.author: a TripAdvisor user
611846539.reviewBody: Young actors explained to us in brief the main events that preceded  Torre\u00f3n founding and the main historical dates and happenings . We got to hear about the cotton plantation,  Europeans and Mestizo and all immigrants settling down and succeeding .   We had never heard about the Chinese Genocide in the area and how it lost a main source of water ... a river . \nI would certainly visit it again

address.streetAddress: Cepeda 354, Centro Historico

594490123.name: A beautiful place and a most interesting one!
594490123.author: a TripAdvisor user
594490123.reviewBody: This is a very well organized Museum.  The building although inside renovated and adapted to modernly house the Museum is the old Casino de la Laguna, a building from 1910 I think.  This is a first class museum that has beautiful art and Mexico\'s and this region\'s  history too.  They have permanent exhibition areas and also special rotating ones.

address.streetAddress: Cepeda 354, Centro Historico

588648448.name: Extensive museum
588648448.author: a TripAdvisor user
588648448.reviewBody: I love visiting museums and Mexico has some very good ones. Plus, as a teacher I get in for usually half off, by showing an educational institution ID.\nArocena had a little of everything--many rooms to explore! Definitely worth a visit. I spent two-hours there...could have stayed longer.

address.streetAddress: Cepeda 354, Centro Historico

544298633.name: First Class Museum in a surprisingly lovely and interesting city
544298633.author: a TripAdvisor user
544298633.reviewBody: I visited friends at Torreon in October/November 2017. I had not expected to find the museums and theatres, which are truly centres with a high standard of culture both in art and music as well as in history and archeology. The Museo Arocena is a modern, purpose-built museum with something for everyone: a fine collection of paintings and all the history and geography you would want to know about Torreon and Mexico in general.When I visited there was also an exhibition of photographs of 21st Century Mexican enclosed nuns, quite breathtaking. I would highly recommend a visit.

address.streetAddress: Cepeda 354, Centro Historico

502554381.name: Pleasant Surprise
502554381.author: a TripAdvisor user
502554381.reviewBody: We had a business meeting on site and took the opportunity to tour the museum.  Our one hour tour was too little time.   Really enjoyed what we saw.  Congratulations on having such a complete and thoroughly enjoyable museum.

address.streetAddress: Cepeda 354, Centro Historico

501331320.name: Extremely well maintained and interesting museum
501331320.author: a TripAdvisor user
501331320.reviewBody: It is an attraction at La Laguna that You cannot miss.  They display Art not only from Mexico, but as well as from Europe and Asia.  The people that work within this museum are extremely well informed and cultivated.

address.streetAddress: Cepeda 354, Centro Historico

463077192.name: Wow!! What a great collection!
463077192.author: a TripAdvisor user
463077192.reviewBody: A great modern museum. Gives a great history of a prominent family from Torreon. There\'s a Murrillo in the museum art collection! Also, a fabulous history lesson on Mexico and the state of Coahuila. Go on Sunday, when it\'s free!

address.streetAddress: Cepeda 354, Centro Historico

433071009.name: Good for the City
433071009.author: a TripAdvisor user
433071009.reviewBody: It\'s hard to rate museums in a small city, especially when having visited the Louvre.  This offers a great insight into some of the culture here, much of it religious. The location is great for this city, and it definitely helps pass the time.

address.streetAddress: Cepeda 354, Centro Historico

305553313.name: Great exhibitions every month.
305553313.author: a TripAdvisor user
305553313.reviewBody: Great exhibitions every month, good to visit. Limited parking all around, you may need to walk a few blocks.

address.streetAddress: Cepeda 354, Centro Historico

230781875.name: A great surprise!
230781875.author: a TripAdvisor user
230781875.reviewBody: I used to live in Torre\u00f3n many yeras ago, it was a pleasant surprise to find that right downton in an old building they set up this fantastic museum called Casa Arosena, it is an old mansi\u00f3n where the Arosena family used to live, i has  the original furnishings, plus a new historical museum, it is a place you should visit if you go to Torre\u00f3n.

address.streetAddress: Cepeda 354, Centro Historico

210852512.name: Must see..among few attractions
210852512.author: a TripAdvisor user
210852512.reviewBody: Nicely kept Museum. Small enough to view in one day regardless of the showings. Small interactive library and one can learn about the city\u00b4s history in a snap. It is in the Dowtown \u00e1rea and parking is very dificult if you have a car.

address.streetAddress: Cepeda 354, Centro Historico

544299856.name: 19th Century Villa overlooking the city of Torreon
544299856.author: a TripAdvisor user
544299856.reviewBody: The old house is not particularly attractive, though it does contain the odd item of interest, such as the rectangular piano. You are obliged to watch a rather unsatisfactory video on arrival and you are not allowed to take photographs. The young ladies working there are friendly and enjoy a chat, but their knowledge of the house and family is limited. Nevertheless, if you have the time, do include it on your programme.

address.streetAddress: Calzada industrial Col. Durangueña

342911808.name: Poorly maintained and only a few historic pieces that are real
342911808.author: a TripAdvisor user
342911808.reviewBody: Normally I recommend historic places. But this one, is just not worth your time. It is in poor condition, the small theater is closed and there are,  at the most, 2 or 3 original pieces that relate to this building and its history. If you do go, make sure it is with a local person. The place is located in a dangerous \u00e1rea of this city and it is easy for a visitor to get lost.

address.streetAddress: Calzada industrial Col. Durangueña

281219694.name: Beautifull castillo
281219694.author: a TripAdvisor user
281219694.reviewBody:
This is the general area where the town of Toreon began. This is now (since 1993) a museum but it was originally built by the architect Federico Wulff for his family. This man was also responsible for several buildings in Torreon such as the Hotel Salvador, the Banco Comermex and many others. He was also the designer of the original plan of Torreon.
The Casa del Cerro  has 15 rooms and a basement. At the foot of the building, two other construction (one of which was Federico Wulff’s office) are today used for expositions. We were fortunate to see one of paintings by  Xavier Angel Kermedy and one of sculptures by Jose Luis Ponce Diaz.
This house was built for confort. No need of air conditionning for the construction was such that the circulation of air is sufficient to keep this house cool. Also, there are apertures in the floors for throwing dirty clothes don for cleaning by the servants.
The wood floors and ceilings as well as the wooden furniture are beautifull. The view from the top floor is fantastic.
This is a highly recommended visit.

address.streetAddress: Calzada industrial Col. Durangueña

673758970.name: Torre\u00f3n\u2019s main tourist attraction
673758970.author: a TripAdvisor user
673758970.reviewBody: A must-do if you\u2019re in Torre\u00f3n. You can hike up the mountain if you\u2019re feeling fit, take a taxi/drive to the top, or take the cable car from the center. The cable car and the mountaintop offer excellent views of Torre\u00f3n and even G\u00f3mez Palacio across the border.

611847929.name: A must-do!
611847929.author: a TripAdvisor user
611847929.reviewBody: A must-do ! I was told we would get to see Torre\u00f3n and all the vistas from the top and it ended up being a ReligiousPilgrimage.\n\n

594364085.name: Amazing expirence
594364085.author: a TripAdvisor user
594364085.reviewBody: Within the past 12 months they were working on a ski lift that takes you from the city to the top. It\u2019s about 30 pesos per person but well worth it. It\u2019s a beauty and if you are near by it\u2019s a must to check it out!

593821070.name: Beautiful and serene
593821070.author: a TripAdvisor user
593821070.reviewBody:
Having been to the area frequently, I’ve wanted to stop here. Parking was about $2.60 (50 Mexican pesos). There is no admittance fee. There was a nun who gave us some literature to read and we self-toured the site. There are a lot of stairs and it is not handicapped accessible. There is a chapel on site and all of the grounds are impeccably maintained. The view is breathtakingly gorgeous. There is the large statue of Christ and other areas that recreate His life. 

A quick walk around the site leads to the gondola rides over the city. This section is also well-maintained. There were many School tours going on. The ten or so minute ride was fine, and an enjoyable way to see the city. I believe it was around three dollars American for adults and perhaps $1.50 for kids. 

We went in the morning. There was never any concern for us for our safety nor did we feel we were in danger. We traveled by family car there. 

It was a great experience. There’s a snack shop and cafeteria if one is inclined. We had the gelato and it was delicious.

588407690.name: Best view of the city
588407690.author: a TripAdvisor user
588407690.reviewBody: It definitely is a must-see landmark, the third largest Jesus in Latin America, it now boasts an access through hanging cable cars and the place is filled with religious authentic relics and some replicas. Bring water, sunblock and a hat for this part of Northern Mexico is sunny almost year round.

555271557.name: Christ of the Noas
555271557.author: a TripAdvisor user
555271557.reviewBody: An inspirational place with spectacular views of Torreon and La Laguna. Easily accessible by car and for those seeking adventure you can climb the stairs. A new cable car awaits as well.

554591547.name: One and done
554591547.author: a TripAdvisor user
554591547.reviewBody: Really cool to see once but do not believe I will be going back. Provides a beautiful view of Torreon and makes for great pictures.

544299229.name: Hideous modern religious buildings, but breathtaking views of the city
544299229.author: a TripAdvisor user
544299229.reviewBody: I was taken by car to see the Cristo (huge statue of Christ), the church and many chapels, as well as the magnificent views of Torreon and the surrounding countryside. It\'s worth the ride up for the views. Personally, I found the church buildings horrid and without taste or architectural interest. The idea was to replicate the places of pilgrimage in the Holy Land.

510739942.name: Great view.
510739942.author: a TripAdvisor user
510739942.reviewBody: The Cristo de las Noas (Christ of the Noas) is the main Religious place to go in Torre\u00f3n. The complex is at the top of the Cerro de las Noas (Noas Mount) frome there you can see all the three sister towns (Torre\u00f3n, Gomez Palacio and Lerdo)

495430263.name: Beautiful and beautiful views!
495430263.author: a TripAdvisor user
495430263.reviewBody: Well worth to drive or bike up there. Excellent road access, and the views over the city and mountains around are truly spectacular. The statue itself, the afferent church and religious building are well worth visiting.

486748118.name: Beautiful view
486748118.author: a TripAdvisor user
486748118.reviewBody: It\u00b4s definitely interesting place which must be visited in Torreon. There is nice view on the city. It is still partially under construction.

479032826.name: Must visit!
479032826.author: a TripAdvisor user
479032826.reviewBody: This is something you must see! Love it! Very special! The route may be challenging but it\'s a must!

433070523.name: Let\'s Visit Jesus
433070523.author: a TripAdvisor user
433070523.reviewBody: We have been lucky enough to visit many religious statues.  There is nothing notable about this location, but it doesn\'t disappoint. If you go at night it is a great city view.

415854931.name: Great view from El Cristo
415854931.author: a TripAdvisor user
415854931.reviewBody: Please check out El Cristo while in Torreon.   The view of the city is great and the church associated with El Cristo is just beautiful.  A must do while in Torreon

350649844.name: A long drive to not see much
350649844.author: a TripAdvisor user
350649844.reviewBody: Once you drive through the city and through the lower income neighborhoods you get to the top. There is a few places to walk into and then a view of all Torreon. Really not much to look at and there are better things to do with free time

339819274.name: Christ
339819274.author: a TripAdvisor user
339819274.reviewBody: This isna nice place to spend a couple of hours sightseeing the city from above. Its cheap about 5 dollars the entrance. Uour need to be in a car or a taxi because the stairs are to many and in a dangerous neighborhood

286987313.name: Another statue
286987313.author: a TripAdvisor user
286987313.reviewBody:
This is a statue of Christ the Savior. It isn't as big as the one in Rio but it is big. What makes a difference are the buildings surrounding it.

It wasn't easy to get to when we visited and hopefully this has changed.

Whn in Torreon, it is Worth a visit.

266094752.name: Fine if you\'re Catholic
266094752.author: a TripAdvisor user
266094752.reviewBody: I had a colleague take me here.  You get a nice view of the city and it\'s a pretty drive.  There\'s a little chapel there, they were getting it ready for the Easter Services the next week.

243356250.name: Childhood Memorie
243356250.author: a TripAdvisor user
243356250.reviewBody: Christ of the Noas or Cristo de las Noas as the Natives call it  is one of the most memorable places in this City I love to come back and enjoy the view of my hometown brings me back to my childhood, I do recommend going in the day time in a big group don\'t go by yourself or as a couple. Have Fun!

234160915.name: Great view!
234160915.author: a TripAdvisor user
234160915.reviewBody: I had a great time, got there when sun was about to set. Beautiful views of the city, without a doubt I will be back there.

226070010.name: You get the best experience (day and night) if you go on sunset
226070010.author: a TripAdvisor user
226070010.reviewBody:
I'd personally say, day sighting of this landmark is mandatory, but definitely not the best one.
At night, you can hear through the speakers (located in various places in the spot) gregorian-ish music, the wind starts and all the lights (the ones from the city and the ones from the chapels) give the place a very magic and insightful atmosphere.

I don't know if its already safe again due to the criminality issues in recent years... check before you go, definitely worth it.

157229347.name: Best part of the trip
157229347.author: a TripAdvisor user
157229347.reviewBody: This is a MUST if you are in Torreon. It\'s built to be like the sites in Jerusalem so it\'s really neat to walk around the grounds and see the different parts. It also gives you a great view of the city, so it\'s a win-win.

149032669.name: want to die?
149032669.author: a TripAdvisor user
149032669.reviewBody: beatiful city views, nice church,  but at this time, very dangerous. lot\'s of drive by shootings, and any other crime ou might think of.

130984065.name: Great place to visit, great photo opps
130984065.author: a TripAdvisor user
130984065.reviewBody: A lot to see here. El Cristo of course, which lights up at night beautifully. The chapel, many capillas, lots to walk around and see - statues and art all around. Great views of the city of course! There is a place there that sells delicious ice cream as well ...and we also heard there was a restaurant in the works.

122837687.name: Best view of Torreon
122837687.author: a TripAdvisor user
122837687.reviewBody: While Torreon isn\'t a typical tourist destination, the city has nice people and part of that may be because Jesus is always watching... Serioulsy, wherever you are in the city, you can see the Cristo.  When you go to the Cristo, there are a LOT of things to see--chapels, the via crucis, and magnificent views (day and night).  If you take the time to walk around and take things in, you\'ll truly enjoy the Cristo de las Noas.

600888609.name: Unico y maravilloso museo
600888609.author: a TripAdvisor user
600888609.reviewBody:
No te debes perder visitarlo, te encontraras con multiples y avriados minerales que se extraen de la mina.

Tienen una vasta exposicion de los diferentes minerales.
Nosotros nos trajimos una hermosa piedra, que ahora sirve como ""pesebre"""para el niño Dios en nuestro nacimiento en Navidad.  Ademas de traer un rudimentario microcopio con lupa, para ver la piuedra de cuarzo.

Un lugar limpio, silencioso, bien catalogado... No te pierdas el visitarlo.

address.streetAddress: Bulevard Laguna 3200 Poniente Colonia Metalurgica

509752381.name: Excelente opci\u00f3n
509752381.author: a TripAdvisor user
509752381.reviewBody: El Museo es una gran opci\u00f3n para visitar en la ciudad, su hermosa estructura y sus interesantes exposiciones son suficientes para tenerlo en cuenta. A esto le agregamos la excelente organizaci\u00f3n y el trato tan c\u00e1lido que sus empleados te ofrecen, sin duda de los mejores museos en la regi\u00f3n.

address.streetAddress: Bulevard Laguna 3200 Poniente Colonia Metalurgica

509733946.name: "Excelente museo"
509733946.author: a TripAdvisor user
509733946.reviewBody: Me encant\u00f3 el lugar, la historia, las instalaciones, la organizaci\u00f3n y las personas que te atienden son muy amables y te hacen sentir en confianza. Todo lo que tiene el museo es muy interesante y es la oportunidad para conocer sobre los metales de una forma diferente y din\u00e1mica.

address.streetAddress: Bulevard Laguna 3200 Poniente Colonia Metalurgica

509728531.name: Excelente Museo
509728531.author: a TripAdvisor user
509728531.reviewBody: Ubicado en uno de los lugares mas antiguos de Torre\u00f3n, hace al Museo de los Metales una joya, ordenado y con un excelente recorrido.\nRecomendado para visitar con la familia o los amigos.

address.streetAddress: Bulevard Laguna 3200 Poniente Colonia Metalurgica

509727047.name: Descubre porque Torre\u00f3n es la Capital Mundial de la Plata
509727047.author: a TripAdvisor user
509727047.reviewBody: Es un inmueble que en s\u00ed cuenta una gran historia al ser conservado originalmente, aqu\u00ed encontrar\u00e1s la importancia de los metales en el desarrollo de la vida humana, si tienes oportunidad busca una visita guiada tienes que agendar al 871 729 55 00 ext 7030 as\u00ed disfrutaras mayormente cada una de las salas. Es un museo que ofrece a los ni\u00f1os \u00e1reas interactivas y talleres que los mantendr\u00e1 encantados.

address.streetAddress: Bulevard Laguna 3200 Poniente Colonia Metalurgica

484692795.name: bonito lugar
484692795.author: a TripAdvisor user
484692795.reviewBody: lugar bonito para conocerlo, podras encontrar la historia de como se forjo la compa\u00f1ia pe\u00f1oles y origines de la ciudad

address.streetAddress: Bulevard Laguna 3200 Poniente Colonia Metalurgica

473403741.name: interesante pero rapido
473403741.author: a TripAdvisor user
473403741.reviewBody: el museo es chico no tiene mucho que ver pero lo que hay es ineteresante ya que la informacino es bunea

address.streetAddress: Bulevard Laguna 3200 Poniente Colonia Metalurgica

455718546.name: Muy grata sorpresa
455718546.author: a TripAdvisor user
455718546.reviewBody: El museo est\u00e1 muy bien organizado y la exhibici\u00f3n es interesant\u00edsima, pues uno de verdad termina d\u00e1ndose cuenta de la importancia de los metales en nuestra vida. Los gu\u00edas son muy amables y cuentan con un conocimiento profundo sobre los temas del museo. Las instalaciones son llamativas y din\u00e1micas. Es de los mejores museos que he visitado en la provincia mexicana.

address.streetAddress: Bulevard Laguna 3200 Poniente Colonia Metalurgica

409467051.name: HISTORIA VIVA
409467051.author: a TripAdvisor user
409467051.reviewBody: si quieres conocer un poco de la historia de nuestra ciudad, no dejes de vistar el museo de los metales, que solo el edificio donde se encuentra  es una belleza, y donde ademas encontraras muestras de muchos minerales  que son tratados en la planta de pe\u00f1oles

address.streetAddress: Bulevard Laguna 3200 Poniente Colonia Metalurgica

387600425.name: Vale la pena conocerlo
387600425.author: a TripAdvisor user
387600425.reviewBody: Esta al interior de la planta de Pe\u00f1oles que en s\u00ed misma parece una ciudad por su magnitud. El edificio es antiguo, aunque muy bien remodelado y adaptado para museo, por lo que las exposiciones son interesantes y bien logradas. No es f\u00e1cil encontrarlo pero definitivamente vale la pena el viaje.

address.streetAddress: Bulevard Laguna 3200 Poniente Colonia Metalurgica

382034410.name: Hermosos museo...
382034410.author: a TripAdvisor user
382034410.reviewBody: Me cost\u00f3 trabajo llegar ya que ni los taxistas sab\u00edan d\u00f3nde estaba, pero cuando lo encontr\u00e9 me lleve una grata sorpresa, no hab\u00eda visitantes, tuvimos el museo solo para nosotros, todo en el es hermoso, las muestras que tiene, los acabados de madera le dan un toque cl\u00e1sico y muy bello, adem\u00e1s de la excelente vista que tiene, lo recomiendo ampliamente, solo ll\u00e9vense un mapa por qu\u00e9 no es muy conocido.

address.streetAddress: Bulevard Laguna 3200 Poniente Colonia Metalurgica

367633692.name: Un gran museo
367633692.author: a TripAdvisor user
367633692.reviewBody: Es un museo diferente a lo conocido. Nos ense\u00f1a los metales de la planta de Pe\u00f1oles. Se dan paseos para escuelas.

address.streetAddress: Bulevard Laguna 3200 Poniente Colonia Metalurgica

367327309.name: Aprende historia sobre miner\u00eda
367327309.author: a TripAdvisor user
367327309.reviewBody: Dentro de lo que fu\u00e9 parte de Pe\u00f1oles, la principal productora de plata refinada del mundo y oro de latinoam\u00e9rica, se puede ver aspectos importantes sobre la historia, un museo que desde que entras te empiesas a meter por el tunel del tiempo a la historia, buena guia a grupos, adem\u00e1s de exposiciones temporales, ojal\u00e1 todas las grandes empresas te dieran algo as\u00ed

address.streetAddress: Bulevard Laguna 3200 Poniente Colonia Metalurgica

318326563.name: Museo de los metales, empresa Pe\u00f1oles
318326563.author: a TripAdvisor user
318326563.reviewBody: La empresa Pe\u00f1oles tiene un buen n\u00famero de minas alrededor del mundo, incluyendo la Mina Santa Rita, en Mapim\u00ed, Durango y otra en Fresnillo, Zacatecas. Mediante este museo que se ubica dentro de las instalaciones de la instituci\u00f3n, podremos conocer acerca de la historia de los minerales y metales preciosos, as\u00ed como el proceso de fundici\u00f3n y el impacto que ha tenido esta actividad a lo largo de los a\u00f1os.

address.streetAddress: Bulevard Laguna 3200 Poniente Colonia Metalurgica

672375775.name: Mucho que ver y visitar
672375775.author: a TripAdvisor user
672375775.reviewBody: Es un excelente centro comercial donde podemos encontrar todo lo que necesitamos. Para todos los gustos y bolsillos.

address.streetAddress: Periferico Raul Lopez Sanchez, 600

633523977.name: La mejor plaza de la Laguna
633523977.author: a TripAdvisor user
633523977.reviewBody: Es la mayor plaza de la regi\u00f3n Lagunera. Las tienda ancla de base son un Liverpool y un Sears. \nSi vas en plan de buscar comida hay restaurantes de cadena y la secci\u00f3n de comida r\u00e1pida

address.streetAddress: Periferico Raul Lopez Sanchez, 600

631578835.name: No hay mas
631578835.author: a TripAdvisor user
631578835.reviewBody: Cl\u00e1sica plaza comercial ancla de las ciudades pero que lamentablemente s\u00f3lo hay una y a donde asisten una cantidad importante de personas al grado de la saturaci\u00f3n y la incomodidad

address.streetAddress: Periferico Raul Lopez Sanchez, 600

616520903.name: Prentende ser lujoso
616520903.author: a TripAdvisor user
616520903.reviewBody: Algo comun y corriente, marcas de menos prestigio que otras galer\u00edas. Lo cual conlleva a precios mas accesibles. El lugar es pasadero lo mejor que yo vi fieron las opciones de comida

address.streetAddress: Periferico Raul Lopez Sanchez, 600

567362385.name: Moderna
567362385.author: a TripAdvisor user
567362385.reviewBody: Esta galeria \u00e9 muito bonita, tem varias op\u00e7\u00f5es de compra, diversos restaurantes e tamb\u00e9m brinquedos para crian\u00e7as.

address.streetAddress: Periferico Raul Lopez Sanchez, 600

559138991.name: Paseo de fin de semana
559138991.author: a TripAdvisor user
559138991.reviewBody: Si est\u00e1s en Torre\u00f3n, este es el mejor lugar para dar un paseo de fin de semana y hacer algunas compras. 454783297.name: Excelente sede para eventos en Torre\u00f3n
454783297.author: a TripAdvisor user
454783297.reviewBody:
Los mejores eventos de la ciudad se presentan en esta teatro.

Los pros:
- Excelente ubicación (centro de la ciudad)
- Tiene un loby muy grande
- La taquilla tiene buen servicio y amplio horario
- Asientos cómodos y con buen espacio entre ellos
- Buena visibilidad y audio ( al menos la mayor parte del teatro)
- La renta para eventos privados no es demasiado cara.

Los contra:
- No tiene estacionamiento propio
- Zona no muy bonita
- La salida es muy pequeña y al salir se hace cuello de botella

address.streetAddress: C. Cepeda 155 sur Col. Centro Torreon

Tiene buena ac\u00fastica, buen equipo de sonido y la curva is\u00f3ptica es funcional. Ubicado en el mero centro de Torre\u00f3n, es de f\u00e1cil llegada , ya que pasan muchas rutas de cami\u00f3n por esos rumbos. Cuenta con un aforo de 1400 personas aproximadamente.

422656597.name: ACTIVIDADES DEL TEATRO NAZAS
422656597.author: a TripAdvisor user
422656597.reviewBody: El Teatro Nazas es un recinto muy interesante arquitect\u00f3nicamente: Originalmente Fu\u00e9 inaugurado como un cine, asi que su interior conserva algunas caracter\u00edsticas del modernismo, en el foyer se encuentra un mural de 1952 titulado "Riqueza algodonera" que representa las caracter\u00edsticas culturales de la \u00e9poca as\u00ed como el auge agr\u00edcola de la regi\u00f3n, tiene mucha influencia de los muralistas mexicanos del s. XX. Las cartelera es muy variada, hay desde teatro infantil, c\u00f3mico, concierto de m\u00fasica y eventualmente muestras de cine. Cabe destacar que el Teatro Nazas alberga los conciertos de la Camerata de Coahuila, que se presenta 2 meses al mes, vale much\u00edsimo la pena asistir a uno de estos conciertos ya que la concha acustica con la que cuenta el Teatro Nazas es de excelente calidad.

363777498.name: Para amantes de la m\u00fasica cl\u00e1sica
363777498.author: a TripAdvisor user
363777498.reviewBody:
Me encanta la música clásica y por esta razón, este lugar es lo mejor de Torreón. Asistí al concierto de la Camerata de Coahuila dedicado a Tchaikovsky. Quedé enamorado.

La acústica es muy buena, los músicos tocan fenomenal.

Llega media hora antes para que escuches la ponencia que ofrece un experto en el tema, te explicará el contexto histórico del autor y la obra, así como la obra misma. Amé este lugar.

Lo único malo: el horrible público, mucha gente llegó tarde, lo peor del caso es que los dejan entrar durante el concierto. Muy mal! Otro hablando en pleno concierto, otros tomando fotos, otra grabando con el celular y luego reproduciendo lo grabado. ¿Qué les pasa?

300046718.name: Teatro Nazas en Torre\u00f3n Coahuila.
300046718.author: a TripAdvisor user
300046718.reviewBody: En 1952 abri\u00f3 sus puertas como cine y como todo en la vida cumpli\u00f3 su ciclo quedando abandonado por varios a\u00f1os. En 2004 renovado vuelve a abrir como Teatro y desde entonces ha sido una opci\u00f3n cultural de primer nivel para los Laguneros. Tiene una capacidad para 1400 personas y un amplio foyer con el mural original que plasm\u00f3 Octavio R\u00edos en el otrora cine.  Excelente ac\u00fastica. Espacio espec\u00edfico para personas que requieren de sillas de rueda y personal que te ayuda a ubicar tu asiento.  Abierto a obras de teatro locales y for\u00e1neas, conferencias, Opera, Ballet y actualmente casa de la Camerata de Coahuila que dos viernes de cada mes en temporada nos deleitan con sus selecciones de m\u00fasica cl\u00e1sica bajo la direcci\u00f3n de Ram\u00f3n Shade. Recientemente unos 40 min antes de cada funci\u00f3n de la Camerata hay una pl\u00e1tica educativa sobre la selecci\u00f3n musical por escuchar.  Lugar obligado a visitar como Lagunero y para visitantes.

address.streetAddress: C. Cepeda 155 sur Col. Centro Torreon
